content:
Yes, there are several museums and exhibitions around the world where you can see illuminated manuscripts in person. Here are a few examples:

1. The British Library - located in London, this library has an extensive collection of illuminated manuscripts from various countries and periods.

2. The Morgan Library and Museum - located in New York City, this museum has a vast collection of manuscripts, including medieval and Renaissance illuminated manuscripts.

3. The Getty Center - located in Los Angeles, this museum features a wide range of art, including illuminated manuscripts from various cultures and time periods.

4. The Bibliothèque nationale de France - located in Paris, this library has an extensive collection of illuminated manuscripts, including the famous Tres Riches Heures du Duc de Berry.

5. The Vatican Library - located in Rome, this library has a collection of manuscripts that includes illuminated manuscripts from the Middle Ages.

6. The Chester Beatty Library - located in Dublin, this museum has an impressive collection of manuscripts from different parts of the world, including illuminated manuscripts from the Middle East and Asia.

These are just a few examples, and there are many more museums and exhibitions around the world where you can see illuminated manuscripts in person.
